meanings.definition: Giving someone support, confidence, or hope.
meanings.sent1: Her smile was encouraging, making me feel more confident about the test.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's encouraging words motivated the students to keep trying.
meanings.sent3: The encouraging puppy wagged its tail, urging me to play fetch.
meanings.sent4: The encouraging sunrise painted the sky with vibrant colors, promising a beautiful day ahead.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging cheers from the crowd lifted the athlete's spirits as she crossed the finish line.

meanings.sent1: His encouraging nod indicated that he approved of my idea.
meanings.sent2: The encouraging applause from the audience showed their support for the performer.
meanings.sent3: The encouraging high-five from his friend confirmed that he made the right decision.
meanings.sent4: The encouraging banner displayed in the stands rallied the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging smiles on their faces reassured her that she was on the right track.

meanings.definition: Making someone more likely to do something.
meanings.sent1: The encouraging weather forecast encouraged us to plan a picnic.
meanings.sent2: His encouraging words about the benefits of exercise motivated her to start working out.
meanings.sent3: The encouraging scent of freshly baked cookies tempted him to have one more.
meanings.sent4: The encouraging sales pitch persuaded customers to buy the new product.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging progress she saw in her savings account inspired her to save even more.
